resources.string:
Arabic: بنو قاسم‎‎ (according to numismatic findings) 

 Benicassim is situated in the province of Castellón. It has an estimated population of around 19,000 inhabitants, but during the summer it reaches approximately 60,000. 

 Benicassim offers six kilometers of sandy beaches with numerous services, installations and infrastructure to fully enjoy the stay: cleaning, public access, showers, feet showers, free drinkable water, beach-volley courts, floating diving boards with toboggans, wooden umbrellas… 

 These beaches have been awarded the Blue Flag for Clean Seas of Europe since 1987. The coast zone is divided into five beaches, where there is also a promenade, along with special corridors for bikes, rollers, and runners.

The province of Castellón, and in particular Benicassim, offers many activities to take advantage of during your free time. In the inland region, there is also the natural park of "Desiert de las Palmas", where you can enjoy the calm and serenity of nature and find a lot of local species. \n\n The highest level is the Mount of Bartolo with an altitude of 729 meters. From there you can see the Columbrete Islands, which are 50 kilometers off the coast.

In Benicassim you can practice a lot of different sports like golf, tennis, squash/fronton, diving, wind surfing and sailing. Nearby, in the port area of Castellón, named El Grao de Castellón, there is a planetarium, a marina and an air club. \n\n Benicassim has an excellent climate that allows you to enjoy any outdoor activity you want to do or just take a walk and enjoy your stay.
Simple rooms in a casual hotel offering free breakfast, Wi-Fi, a poolside bar and bike rentals.
Av. Ferrandis Salvador, 184, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain
Unfussy option with simple rooms, a pool, a spa, as well as free breakfast and parking.
Av. Gimeno Tomas, 1, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
Casual beachfront hotel offering a sea-view restaurant and a cafe/bar with a terrace.
Paseo Marítimo Pilar Coloma, 1, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain
Modest rooms in a casual lodging with a restaurant, lounge bar, outdoor pool, and free breakfast.
Gran Av. Jaume I, 217, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
Airy, unpretentious hotel featuring relaxed rooms, some with balconies and sea views, others with a terrace.
Av. Castalia, 46, 12100 El Grao de Castellón, Castellón, Spain
Av. Ferrandis Salvador, 186, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain
A renowned restaurant where you can enjoy the most delicious pizzas, in the middle of a quiet and familiar atmosphere.
Av. Ferrandis Salvador, 124-126, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain
Av. Ferrandis Salvador, 141, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain

Tapas / Paëllas on Saturday and Sundays / Rice and Fideuás Specialities
Carrer Sant Tomàs, 15, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
Plaça de l\'Estació, 11, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
Carrer Strassen Bad Salzdetfurth, 11, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain

Gran Av. Jaume I, 87, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
Gran Av. Jaume I, 10, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
Avda. de Barcelona, 21, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain
Avinguda de Castelló, 56, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain

The contribution of natural sand and a peak, have provided the Voramar beach an enviable surface of fine golden sand. The surroundings is defined by a promenade carefully taken care of that is located behind the traditional villas that are one of the characteristic images of Benicassim. Walking along the promenade is one of the most typical activities, although it is also provided with several facilities, such as pedal-boats, water skates, canoes and windsurfing boards hiring.

There you will find an extensive promenade in which the visitor while enjoying the company of sea can use the amenities of the Library of the Sea, during the summer. It also has a cycleway that connects Benicassim with Castellón and allows leisure and sports always beside the sea. During the summer season activities such as gymnastics is carried out on the beach, as well as tourist entertainment and leisure activities, for example, movies on the beach. You can rent boats and surfboards.

"Torreon" is named after the magnificent tower overlooking this beach, one of the crowded beaches during the summer and throughout the year. It brings together many events day and night throughout the summer, as the Festival of Habanera or the ”Night of San Juan” (Midsummer), as well as movies on the beach. Also tourist activities are carried out on the beach such as gymnastics and numerous competitions. There are volleyball courts and games for children. You can also hire sunshades, sunbeds and pedal boats, during the summer.

An excellent beach regenerated with natural sand. A promenade goes along its extension of fine sand and only two peaks separate it from adjacent beaches and shelter it from swell. This beach is adapted to people with reduced mobility. It is the southern extension of the Voramar beach, so that its characteristics are similar. Like the Voramar beach Almadraba Beach provides a sense of calm. It is a sandy beach with a gentle slope. One of its most important features is that it is an accessible beach. It has gateways to shore.

The protection of spikes gives the beach an oval shape, which shelters it from draughts and forms two inlets very suitable for bathing or getting initiated in water sports. The existence of a sailing school and a youth hostel which gives it a young atmosphere.
Club de Golf Costa de Azahar

The Costa de Azahar Golf Club has a nine-hole course surrounded by pine trees and located 50 meters from the beach of Grao de Castellón. The Club also has tennis courts as well as teachers and summer courses. The situation of the Club, Grao-Benicasim road, allows the amateur to practice these sports within the tourist area Costa de Azahar. The Costa de Azahar Golf Club is one of the oldest courses in the Mediterranean area. Located just 6 km from the center of Castellón and 12 km from Benicasim.
Avda. Ferrandis Salvador, s/n, 12100 El Grao de Castellón, Castellón, Spain
Urbanización La Coma s/n, 12190 Borriol, Castellón, Spain

It was in the year 1970 , when a group of tennis fans, owners of the apartments Torremar, constituted the Tennis Club Torremar in lands adjacent to these apartments. It is therefore one of the oldest in the province of Castellón . Since then the club, which started with 3 clay courts, has grown in size and social mass. The Club is a very pleasant place for public relations and coexistence between partners, for the facilities it possesses and the wonderful climate that we enjoy in Benicasim.
Carre Madre María Antonia de Oviedo, 3, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain

Since 1959, the aerodrome of Pinar has been managed by a non-profit association, whose main purpose is the dissemination of aeronautical culture. Since then, it has become an important attraction infrastructure for aeronautical tourism in our province, and contributes to the creation of many jobs. Its private pilot school, ULM and RPA are managed by true passionate aviation staff, with extensive experience, and that will make your training as a pilot something unforgettable and extremely safe. In addition, the Aeroclub de Castellón is home to important national and international sporting events, as well as the pool of high-level national team athletes.
Camino La Plana, s/n, 12100 El Grao de Castellón, Castellón, Spain
Come and feel the speed at the best karts track of Benicasim
Eight fantastic tracks to enjoy with friends and family.
Carrer dels Frares, 12560 Benicàssim, Castelló, Spain
The most entertaining Waterpark in the Mediterranean is in Benicàssim, where we make the best waffles in the world!
Carretera Nacional 340, Km. 986,8, 12560 Benicasim, Castellón, Spain
Parque natural del Desierto de las Palmas

This park of 3,293 hectares was declared natural place by the Valencian government on October 16, 1989. Burned on several occasions 1985 and 1992 leaving as is evident little wild forest. The name of the place is due to the presence of a mendicant Carmelite order, which in this way refers to spaces dedicated to spiritual retreat (the "Saints Deserts" 1). The second part of the name is due to the abundance of the palm heart (Chamaerops humilis), the only endemic palm of Europe. The mountain range is located in the region of La Plana Alta
Camí de les Villes, 12004 Castelló de la Plana, Castelló, Spain

The FIB is an annual music festival which takes place in the town of Benicàssim, Spain. It focuses mainly on pop, rock and electronica artists, as well as having other elements including short films, fashion shows and art. Benicassim has a reputation as being among the best on the international festival circuit. The festival begins on the second Monday of July when the camping grounds open, although music only officially commences during Thursday afternoon. FIB is notable for having bands playing through the night (5pm - 8am) and has three main stages, Las Palmas, Visa and South Beach Dance having a capacity of approximately 30,000, 15,000 and 8,000 people respectively. In 2009, the festival capacity exceeded 50,000 and in 2016, over 150,000 visited the festival across the four days.
Carretera N-340, km 986,300, 12560 Benicàssim, Castellón, Spain

Rototom Sunsplash is a large European reggae festival, it takes place every summer at Benicassim, a few miles north of Valencia in Spain. The festival imitates the traditional Jamaican Reggae Sunsplash and since 1994 calls from various European countries thousands of reggae passionated people, thanks to concerts of international musicians, often many Jamaicans.
Recinto de Festivales ubicado en la carretera N-340, km. 986,300.
